channel.title: Version Control on Scientific Programming
channel.description: Recent content in Version Control on Scientific Programming

item.title: Getting Started
GitHub and Collaborating
item.description: Storing your repository somewhere safe You have a history of your changes locally, but that’s not much good if your hard drive fails. We’ll now show you how keep a history remotely. Git is known as a ‘distributed version control’ system. Generally, you host a repository somewhere online. There are lots of different providers for this. Version Control Websites GitHub - free! Now owned by Microsoft. Lots of integrations with other services.

item.title: Discarding Temporary Changes
item.description: Discarding channges 1) If you make some changes to the file workshop.txt, but then decide that they weren’t correct or were unnecessary, you can easily get back to the head of the branch with the following command: git reset HEAD workshop.txt This permanently discards these changes! Resetting the whole repository If you have multiple files that have been changed, and you want to reset all of them, you can use:
